Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: His Eminence Timothy Michael Cardinal Dolan, Archbishop of New York, 1011 First Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10022.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vallone.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: His Eminence Timothy Michael Cardinal Dolan, Archbishop of New York, 1011 First Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10022.



Council Member Vallone moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of July 23, 2015 and August 13, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lancman.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Lancman, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of July 23, 2015 and August 13, 2015  be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Arva R. Rice, candidate for re-appointment by the Council to the New York City Equal Employment Practices Commission pursuant to § 830 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Arva R. Rice, Equal Employment Practices Commission

Items.Title: Helen Arteaga, Council candidate for designation and subsequent appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors, pursuant to section 7384 of the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Helen Arteaga, Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 356 West 44th Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 3, Application No. 20165009 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 356 West 44th St, Borough of Manhattan (20165009 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 221 West Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 1, Application No. 20165108 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 221 West Broadway, Manhattan (20165108 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Barron:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 150318 PQK be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 10300 Foster Ave, Brooklyn (C 150318 PQK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution praising Pope Francis for his lifelong pursuit of peace among all peoples and commends him on his upcoming historic visit to New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Praising Pope Francis for his lifelong pursuit of peace among all peoples and commends him on his upcoming historic visit to NYC.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of air conditioning systems
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to provide reports regarding the number of inmates who are on  waiting lists for placement in or transfer to alternative housing
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to provide reports regarding the number of inmates who are on waiting lists for placement in or transfer to alternative housing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the visitation of incarcerated individuals.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the visitation of incarcerated individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend New York city charter, in relation to renaming the office of the criminal justice coordinator as the office of criminal justice, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the office of criminal justice to post on the office’s website an annual report regarding bail and the criminal justice system.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office of criminal justice to post on the office’s website an annual report regarding bail and the criminal justice system.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the dept of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the department's grievance system.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to post a quarterly report on the population demographics of the city's jails.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the revocation, suspension, or refusal to renew a cigarette dealer license due to the sale of synthetic drugs or imitation synthetic drugs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Revocation, suspension, or refusal to renew a cigarette dealer license due to the sale of synthetic drugs or imitation synthetic drugs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to identifying and addressing environmental justice issues
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Identifying and addressing environmental justice issues.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the sale of green lasers in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Banning the sale of green lasers in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of inoperative or decommissioned fire hydrants
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Removal of inoperative or decommissioned fire hydrants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of parking meter regulations on days that New York City public schools are closed because of inclement weather
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Suspension of parking meter regulations on days that NYC public schools are closed because of inclement weather.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the retention of data on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Retention of data on the open data portal.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the inequitable contract between the City of New York and LinkNYC which will provide better Wi-Fi access to areas throughout the City where advertising is deemed more profitable, and calling for revenue sharing profits from this contract to be invested in efforts to increase Wi-Fi access in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Condemning the inequitable contract between NYC and LinkNYC which will provide better Wi-Fi access to areas throughout the City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to introduce and pass legislation to allow states and municipalities to expand upon the Food and Drug Administration’s nutritional labeling requirements on menus and menu boards
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to introduce and pass legislation to allow states and municipalities to expand upon the FDA’s nutritional labeling requirements on menus and menu boards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifying a business when the city has received a request for service or complaint about its operation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Notifying a business when the city has received a request for service or complaint about its operation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would allow limited liability companies formed in New York to fulfill their publication requirement by publishing on the New York Department of State’s website or on an online news site
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Allow limited liability companies formed in NY to fulfill their publication requirement by publishing on the NY Dept of State’s website or on an online news site.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to locating electrical conductors underground.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Locating electrical conductors underground.

Items.Title: A Local Law to require the department of citywide administrative services to conduct a survey of city contractors in relation to paid family leave policies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Conduct a survey of city contractors in relation to paid family leave policies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.7938 / S.5056-A, an act that would authorize the city of New York to institute a tenant rent increase exemption program for tenants who pay over fifty percent of their incomes in rent and who reside within certain rent-regulated properties
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorize NYC to institute a tenant rent increase exemption program for tenants who pay over fifty percent of their incomes in rent and who reside within certain rent-regulated properties. (A.7938 / S.5056-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to opportunities for LGBT-owned business enterprises in city procurement
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Opportunities for LGBT-owned business enterprises in city procurement.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for electronic waste littering
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Penalties for electronic waste littering.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to include a check box on school lunch forms to enable parents to indicate whether they want regular or vegetarian meal options for children during the school year, and requiring DOE to continually update their forms if any other options are offered in the future.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to include a check box on school lunch forms to enable parents to indicate whether they want regular or vegetarian meal options for children during the school year.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Education Department to expand the State’s financial literacy and personal finance education curriculum to all grades K through 12.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYS Education Dept to expand the State’s financial literacy and personal finance education curriculum to all grades K through 12.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.7272/S.5823-A, in relation to increasing the minimum gross registered vehicle weight requirement for tow trucks to decrease illegal tow truck chasing.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Increasing the minimum gross registered vehicle weight requirement for tow trucks to decrease illegal tow truck chasing. (A.7272/S.5823-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.8186-A/S.5886-A, an act to amend the General Business Law and the Vehicle and Traffic Law, in relation to the transfer of motor vehicles as scrap.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Transfer of motor vehicles as scrap. ( A.8186-A/S.5886-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to opportunities for disabled-owned business enterprises in city procurement
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Opportunities for disabled-owned business enterprises in city procurement.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to expand vegetarian lunch menu options for students at New York City public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to expand vegetarian lunch menu options for students at NYC public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to declaring nuisances related to the sale of synthetic drugs and imitation synthetic drugs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Declaring nuisances related to the sale of synthetic drugs and imitation synthetic drugs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a data dictionary for every data set on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring a data dictionary for every data set on the open data portal.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to procedures and reporting for the Rikers Island nursery program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Procedures and reporting for the Rikers Island nursery program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the standardization of address and geospatial information on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Standardization of address and geospatial information on the open data portal.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the People of the State of New York to amend the State Constitution, and the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation amending the Election Law to establish same-day and online voter registration.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amending the Election Law to establish same-day and online voter registration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the testing of methane gas emissions before the planting of a new or replacement tree
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Testing of methane gas emissions before the planting of a new or replacement tree.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Education to make optional a coding class in grades 6-8 and make compulsory coding class during grades 9-12.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to make optional a coding class in grades 6-8 and make compulsory coding class during grades 9-12.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to offer kosher and halal meals in the Summer Meals Program.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the department of sanitation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all persons under the age of 18 to wear a helmet while operating a bicycle
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation preventing the diversion of funds raised to support the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Preventing the diversion of funds raised to support the MTA.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would require government entities that receive funds from the New York City treasury to submit to the Mayor’s Office of Contract Services a plan detailing its anticipated contracting actions for the upcoming fiscal year.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Require government entities that receive funds from the NYC treasury to submit to the Mayor’s Office of Contract Services a plan detailing its anticipated contracting actions for the upcoming fiscal year.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the review of data requested through FOIL for inclusion on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Review of data requested through FOIL for inclusion on the open data portal.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the acceptance of dispatches by for-hire vehicles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Acceptance of dispatches by for-hire vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of small business services to report on the services provided at workforce1 centers.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of small business services to report on the services provided at workforce1 centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring curb extensions at certain dangerous intersections
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring curb extensions at certain dangerous intersections.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to improving safety along bus routes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Improving safety along bus routes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to study ways to eliminate blind spots on all MTA buses and to equip all of these buses with sensor technology to alert drivers, pedestrians and cyclists when a pedestrian or cyclist is in the bus’ blind spot.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to study ways to eliminate blind spots on all MTA buses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring property owners and the department of sanitation to use a salt substitute to remove snow or ice from streets, roadways and sidewalks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring property owners and the Department of Sanitation to use a salt substitute to remove snow or ice from streets, roadways and sidewalks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing response timelines for public requests on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Establishing response timelines for public requests on the open data portal.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to pass and the President to sign H.R. 208, the Superstorm Sandy Relief and Disaster Loan Program Improvement Act, which would improve the United States Small Business Administration’s disaster assistance program
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Recovery and Resiliency
Items.MatterName: Superstorm Sandy Relief and Disaster Loan Program Improvement Act (H.R. 208)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the timely updating of certain public data sets on the open data portal
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Timely updating of certain public data sets on the open data portal.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to an open data law agency compliance examination
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, S.356 and H.R.699 for requiring a warrant before Internet Service Providers would have to disclose the contents of e-mail communications.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring a warrant before Internet Service Providers would have to disclose the contents of e-mail communications. (S.356/H.R.699)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing penalties for the manufacture, distribution or sale of synthetic cannabinoids and synthetic phenethylamines
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Imposing penalties for the manufacture, distribution or sale of synthetic cannabinoids and synthetic phenethylamines.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, H.R. 1217, also known as the Public Safety and Second Amendment Rights Protection Act of 2015, which closes loopholes in the current gun background check system.

There are two vacant seats in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winners of the November 2015 General Election in the 23rd and 51st Council Districts.

There were 45 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.
